RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOODNIGHT ARCHIE stalked the leader from the three path in the second tier, advanced on the outside at the three eighths pole, drew near the front runner by the quarter pole, was joined by another outside challenger moving into the stretch, these two chased the leader in a set, under urging and encouragement, in the last few jumps GOODNIGHT ARCHIE had wore the leader down and was able to get tot he wire with a nose in front. RAUL'S ENCANTO vied for the early lead, took command and raced on the rail, was challenged by another rival to the outside, cut the corner on the inside and passed the quarter pole front, was chased by an ominous closing pair, dug in and continued to respond well to encouragement, caught in the last jump and just missed. TRAFFIC CONTROL was racing in the four path on the outside, was mid pack and improved position, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, gained ground quickly, drew next to another rival and chased the leader down the stretch as a set, was near the wire and still in contention but came up short in the lst two jumps. DIRECTIONAL stalked the leader from the rail, stayed on the fence and saved ground then faded before the quarter pole. DRIVER raced on the rail, trailed most of the race and was never involved. DANDY LOU missed the break and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Driver
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, trailed, was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Directional
ENTRY.COMMENT: slalked, rail, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Raul's Encanto
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, was challenged, repelled, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Dandy Lou
ENTRY.COMMENT: missed break, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Goodnight Archie
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, stalked, challenged 3/8, up at the wire

ENTRY.NAME: Traffic Control
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, stalked, advanced 3/8, encouraged, battled, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 1M Turf CR: 84. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 3, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 3, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Clai ming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PAINTBRUSH was off iand edged over to run in mid pack, was in hands and rating until the half mile pole, shifted out into the six path and advanced, passed rivals on the outside in the turn, shifted out again into the eight path in the upper stretch, was asked and responded well, gaining ground and closing in on the front runners with each stride, was bale to pass the last of the other runners a few jumps before the wire becoming the winner. EXACTA raced three wide while stalking the leaders, was asked launched a bid at the half mile pole, improved position and shifted into the five path, circled the field through the turn in the six path, was encouraged and responded well at the quarter pole, closing in on the leader with every stride, challenged the leader before the sixteenth marker, battled briefly and took over, led for a few strides but was collared by an outside foe who had followed her around the track and had to settle fo second place today. MOONLIGHT RAIN was off a bit slow, found herself mid pack and in the three path, advanced at he half moving in between rivals, maintained her position through the turn, saved ground, then ran flat in the stretch. WATRUGONNADOKAREN stalked the early pace from the rail, stayed on the rail and saved ground, was tucked inside and behind horses in the turn, waited patiently, had open running room at the quarter pole and closed well passing the original leader, at the same time was passed by two outside closer, continued to close but was caught late by another rival at the wire. SAINT KENNEDY was a bit tardy out of the gates, settled off of the pace in hands, raced in the three path, inching closer to the field down the back side, was given more rein after the half mile marker, moved closer to the pack, stayed in position through the turn, the front runner fanned out a bit giving SAINT KENNEDY room to close down the stretch but she did not have enough. HURRICANE TIZWAY vied for the lead, set the early fractions under pressure form another rival, showed the way into the stretch under encouragement and urging, raced in the three path, was caught near the sixteenth pole and finished flat. FASTED vied for the lead, was strong in her bridle, settled just off of the leaders side in the two path, was rated and stayed in that position then faded. TOP TEN DUCHESS was off slow, raced on the rail, trailed. TEXAS BLUEBONNET was off a step slow, raced in the two path next to another rival, improved position slightly, then tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Top Ten Duchess
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Bluebonnet
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 2w, improved slightly, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Saint Kennedy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 3w, off pace, in hands, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Watrugonnadokaren
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, saved ground, closed up the rail, just missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Exacta
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, stalked, moved 1/2, circled 3/8, challenged 1/8, led, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Moonlight Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, mid pack, 3w, btwn 1/2, maintained, flat

ENTRY.NAME: Fasted
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, keen, stalked, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Hurricane Tizway
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied led, rail, 3 wide, upper, caught 1/16th, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Paintbrush
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack, 5w, in hands, mvd 1/2, 6w, 3/8, 8w, stretch, closed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DARE TO WISH vied for the lead in the three path, was rated and stalked the early leader until after the half, was asked and responded at the seven sixteenth pole where she cleared her front running rival, edged into the two path, was cued at the quarter pole with encouragement and drew off to win by more then seven proving to be much the best today. SHEZA HUNK was three wide and off of the pace, gained ground and closed, was no match for the winner but out finished the rest. EL CALIENTE LADY was racing off of the pace and five wide, maintained her position through out, closed with a mild bid. ITS A GEE THING was off slow and race two wide, was able to pass tired rivals. DERBY DAY LASSIE vied for the lead ,led and set the early fractions, was cleared before the turn and tired. CHATAIN'S FLYER was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Sheza Hunk
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, off pace, closed, out finished the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Its a Gee Thing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 2w, passed tired rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Derby Day Lassie
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, pace, 2w, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Chatain's Flyer
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: El Caliente Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 5w, maintained position, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Dare to Wish
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, rated, cleared 7-16th, 2w, cued 1/4, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STARSNMOTION sent to the front, was in a three way struggle for the lead, rated off of the inside horses and settled a bit,, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, and took control of the race by the quarter pole, drew off to win by many. SUE'S LITTLE ZING raced from mid pack in the five path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled under urging through the turn, then finished flat. SWEET LITTLE ROSE vied for the early lead, raced on the rail, decided to stalk the pace down the back side, saved ground and out finished the rest. CECE WAVE vied for the lead, was in a three way battle early on, was keen in the bridle with the pressure of the other competitors around her, took the lead, set the pace and tired at the quarter pole. COUSIN VICKIE trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Little Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail ,stalked, out finished the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Cece Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, keen, led, gave way 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Sue's Little Zing
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, bid 3/8, circled, urged, flat

ENTRY.NAME: Starsnmotion
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, rated, bid 3/8, challenged 5-16th, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Cousin Vickie
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed through out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Ya rds).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS ARKANSAS was off a step slow, raced from off of the pace in the four path, improved position willingly down the backside, continued through the turn, edged out in the upper stretch, cleared the leaders at the three sixteenth pole, ran a bit green feeling the pressure of another competitor coming from the outside, was corrected, then drifted to the out side and interfered with the rival closing in from the outside, was straightened out and was able to get the wire first.CAT B CAUSE was off a step slow, settled off of the pace and in the two path, gained ground along the inside, launched a bid at the half mile pole, improved position, saved ground in the turn, angled out at he quarter pole, responded to encouragement and closed, had another foe drift out to meet her at the sixteenth pole,, rallied back and finished nicely. GATHER THE FACTS vied for the lead, raced two wide and set the pace, was challenged at the five sixteenth pole, matched strides and battled into the stretch, was caught by the sixteenth pole and faded. SHE'SMYSMOKESHOW vied for the lead, rated and stalked, bid at the three eighths pole, drew next to and challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, matched strides and battled into the furlong ground, was caught by outside closers at the sixteenth pole and faded. DAZZLING THE MOON was off a bit slow, raced four wide and into the middle of the filed, continued to gain ground, raced wide in the turn and closed with a mild bid in the stretch. JAZZ JAZZ JAZZ vied for the lead, was three wide, settled into a stalking position then faded. MUCHO MACHO BABY vied for the lead, raced two wide while showing the way and attending the pace, matched strides with a challenging rival the five sixteenth pole, battled until the sixteenth pole, caught and faded. THERE WAS AN INQUIRY REGARDING THE STRETCH RUN AND A JOCKEY OBJECTION. RIDER OF CAT B CAUSE LODGED AN OBJECTION AGAINST MISS ARKANSAS FOR ALLEDGED INTERGERENCE IN THE STRETCH. AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW MISS ARKANSAS WAS DISQUALIFIED AND PLACED SECOND.

ENTRY.NAME: Cat B Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 2w, moved 1/2, gained, shifted out 1/4, closed

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: DW2 Equine LLC & Channon Farm, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: She'smysmokeshow
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, bid 3/8, challenged 5-16th, matched, faded

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Miss Arkansas
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, bid 1/2, cleared 3-16th, drifted, bumped, up

ENTRY.NAME: Mucho Macho Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w. led, matched, caught, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Gather the Facts
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, led, matched 5-16th, battled stretch, caught, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Dazzling the Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide,, mid pack, improved with a mild bid late

ENTRY.NAME: Jazz Jazz Jazz
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, stalked, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Special Weight Purse 30000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWIFT CUSTOM was off mid pack and raced in the three path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, shifted into the four path, challenged for the lead at the quarter pole, cleared that rival and drew off in the stretch. HALFPRICED was racing in the middle of the field in the four path, advanced at the half, shifted into the two path after the three eighths pole, saved ground and improved position, was encouraged and responded by closing on the rail, failed to switch leads but was still up for second. MALAKI EMPIRE raced three wide from off of the pace, circled the field through the turn and closed down the stretch in time for third place money. ROCK SOLID WORDS raced two wide and off of the pace, saved ground through out, put in a mild bid late. AZTEC GEM showed all the speed early, raced two wide, controlled the pace, drifted in the tun and tired. ROCKET DOCTOR was off a bit slow and was never involved. CLASSIC WARRIOR was off slow and trailed through out. PATIO'S PORCH raced on the rail from mid pack, saved ground and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Patio's Porch
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, saved ground, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Swift Custom
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack, 3w, bid 3/8, 4w, challenged 1/4, drew off willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Halfpriced
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack,4w, moved 1/2, 2 wide, 3/8, saved ground, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Rocket Doctor
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Aztec Gem
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, 2w, led pace, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Solid Words
ENTRY.OWNER: Eleven One Racing Stables LLC (Kevin Roberts)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, off pace, saved ground, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Malaki Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w. off pace, circled turn, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow and trailed through out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 31000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since J une 3 Allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARLI MICHAEL took the lead, and went wire to wire. OAK HILL SOLUTION stalked the leader from the three path, launched a bid at he three eighths pole, raced through the turn and into the stretch in the three path, was under strong urging and determinedly got up for second. ONEFORVIVI raced mid pack and in the two path, maintained position, launched a bid at the quarter pole and out finished the rest,. CALICOCO rwas in the middle of the field and five wide, advanced at the half, circled the field in the turn, shifted out into the eight path, had no late kick. SENATOR CON stalked the pace along the rail, gradually improved position, saved ground, faded. CALLINGINTHENIGHT stalked the early pace from the two path launched a mild bid. STIFF DRINK was never involved. J C'S IN TOWN trailedd through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Charli Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: wire to wire

ENTRY.NAME: Senator Con
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, maintained position, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Callinginthenight
ENTRY.OWNER: Cascio Andrew J and D and F Horse Farms
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Oak Hill Solution
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 3/8, determined

ENTRY.NAME: Oneforvivi
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, bid 1/4, out finished

ENTRY.NAME: Calicoco
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, mvd 1/2, 5w, circled, 8w, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: J C's in Town
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed through out
